results.name: Numbers n such that n^2 + 2 == 0 (mod 9).
comment: Numbers which are not the sum of 3 cubes.
Numbers n such that A010888(n^2) = 7. - _V.J. Pohjola_, Aug 18 2012.
reference: Henri Cohen, Number Theory Volume I: Tools and Diophantine Equations. Springer Verlag (2007) p. 380. - _Artur Jasinski_, Apr 30 2010
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Andrew Sutherland, Sums of three cubes, Slides of a talk given May 07 2020 on the Number Theory Web.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,-1).
formula: G.f.: x*(4*x^2 + x + 4)/(x^3 - x^2 - x + 1). - _Alexander R. Povolotsky_, Feb 15 2009
mathematica: intDigSum[n_] := Total[IntegerDigits[n]]; A156638 = {}; Do[If[Nest[intDigSum, n^2, k] == 7, AppendTo[a, n]], {n, 10^5}]; A156638 (* _V.J. Pohjola_, Aug 18 2012 *)
results.author: _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 12 2009
